items.stem: A popular method for solving systems of linear equations works one of these objects into reduced "row-echelon form." If one of these objects is square, its trace is simply the sum of values along a diagonal, and these mathematical arrangements have an inverse if and only if their determinant is not zero.
These values exist at a function's critical points when the function is concave down.
Composition of these mathematical objects make the codomain of one of them the domain of the other.
